headline: Why GE Vernova (GEV) Is Up 14.9% After Doubling Its Dividend And Expanding Buybacks
summary: Earlier this week, GE Vernova held its 2025 Investor Update, where management reaffirmed 2025 revenue guidance of US$36–US$37 billion, introduced 2026 guidance of US$41–US$42 billion, doubled its quarterly dividend to US$0.50 per share from US$0.25, expanded its share repurchase authorization to US$10 billion, and outlined plans to fund the US$5.30 billion Prolec GE acquisition with a mix of debt and cash. The company also laid out much higher 2028 targets, including over US$10 billion in...

headline: Boom Supersonic’s Latest Move Suggests Aerospace Firms Have a Future in AI
summary: What do supersonic jets and artificial-intelligence data centers have in common?  “The same supersonic technology drives both the Superpower turbine and the Symphony [supersonic] jet engine,” reads part of Boom’s news release.  The Symphony turbine jet engine will power Boom’s Overture supersonic jet.

headline: GE Vernova Stock Drops. Why It Caught a Downgrade After Epic Run.
summary: GE Vernova’s  epic run has taken shares too far, too fast for some on Wall Street.  Seaport analyst Tom Curran downgraded shares to Hold from Buy.  The move came after GE Vernova closed at a record high of$723 a share on Wednesday, rising 15.6% following the company’s Tuesday evening investor event in New York City.

headline: GE Vernova Inks Turbine Deal With Romania Wind Farm
summary: GE Vernova said the company has signed an agreement with Public Power Corporation Renewables (PPC R) to supply, install, and commission 14 of its 6.1 MW–158m turbines for a wind farm in Vaslui County, Romania.

headline: GE Vernova expects to end 2025 with an 80-GW backlog that stretches into 2029
summary: Hyperscalers are pushing the company to squeeze more out of existing production facilities, executives said Tuesday. CEO Scott Strazik said he expects turbine reservations to be sold out through 2030 by the end of 2026.

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Slide as Fed Signals Limited Further Cuts
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Thursday, Dec, 11 2025 US stock futures are pointing lower this morning, with contracts tied to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 down roughly 0.8 to 1.2 percent after the Federal Reserve cut its key interest rate by a quarter of a percent to a range of 3.5 to 3.75 percent and signaled only limited further cuts ahead. That decision pulled the 10 year US government bond yield down to about 4.12 percent, which helps set mortgage, car loan, and credit card...
